channel.title: Need algebra help badly!
channel.description:
Solve these two problems. Show all your steps.
Twice a number increased by 9 is the same as 10 more than the number. What is the number?
The length of a rectangle is 4 more than 2 times the width. The perimeter is 20 cm. Find the width and length
those r 2 different questions, and you need to explain everything you did, and all your calculations. I could do this, but my teacher said there was a mathematical way to do it, not just trial and error. Can someone tell me?
LIST OF THINGS NEEDED [s]1.Mathematical way to do the first one.[/s] 2.Mathematical way to do the second one. 3.Answer for first one (with steps shown). 4.Answer for second one (with steps shown). [center][img]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/Themes/default/images/warnpmod.gif[/img] Quit making multiple posts, please.[/center]

item.title: Need algebra help badly!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Problem #2 Solution

The length of a rectangle is 4 more than 2 times the width.
y = 2x + 4
2 times the length plus 2 times the width equals the perimeter
2y + 2x = 20

Now replace your y value in the second equation.
2y + 2x = 20
2(2x + 4) + 2x = 20
4x + 8 + 2x = 20
6x + 8 = 20
6x = 12
x = 2

Using your new x value, plug it in to your y equation. This is called substitution.
y = 2x + 4
y = 2(2) + 4
y = 4 + 4
y = 8

Check:
y = 2x + 4
8 = 2(2) + 4
8 = 4 + 4
8 = 8
Correct!

Check:
2y + 2x = 20
2(8) + 2(2) = 20
16 + 4 = 20
20 = 20
Correct!

~Ron

Edit: Small correction lol. I made a mistake in the first equation. Sorry, I’m a little gitty over that new bill (in the discussions & debates section) and I fucked up. My mistake! Please change!

Read full topic

item.title: Need algebra help badly!
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

first problem is 1…

2*n+9=n+10

n=1

2 * 1 + 9 = 1 + 10

2*1 = 2
2 + 9 = 11

1 + 10 = 11

really wasn’t hard… took me 10 secs

Read full topic

item.title: Need algebra help badly!
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

(9X)+9=(x+10)

Doesn’t sound right to me

Wouldn’t it be (2*X)+9=X+10
?

If so then the answer would be around 0.5 for X

edit - nator answered in furthur detail in your other thread, check it out =D
